title: Do You Feel Your Age?
content: For the most part, I think I act my age, but yesterday it hit me that I don't really feel my age. Alan told me he wanted to go to dinner with his CEO and his wife and that he wanted me to come. At first, I panicked. I mean, the CEO and his wife? These are real adults we're talking about. Going to dinner with adults (who aren't our parents) was on my to-do list for when I grew up. (As is buying a house, having kids, seriously remembering to take my multivitamins, etc.) Then I remembered I'm almost 30, which, one might say, is a pretty solid adult age, and I wondered if I'll ever feel like a real adult. What do you think? For all you adults out there, do you feel your age?
